page.title: 16MELSONBY-The Parish Council
page.content: The {Parish Council} consists of a Chairman, Secretary and four Councillors, all of whom except the Secretary are {appointed by secret {ballot of the local electorate,}to serve for a term of five years. There has been no need for elections of these Councillors in Melsonby for many years now because there are only enough people willing to take office as there are places to fill. Parish Councils have very little power, {most} of the more{important {decisions }affecting our village such as planning, social & welfare services, housing and general environment are{taken by Richmondshire {District Council.} The Parish Council looks after such things as maintenance of the village green and playing fields.
